fh.0: Do not set up the Hound monster ability deck. Instead, each round on initiative 26, all Hounds perform %game.action.move% 2; %game.action.attack% 2.
fh.1: City Guards do not perform turns but instead gain an additional innate %game.action.shield% 1 (for a total of %game.action.shield% 2 at level 1) and %game.action.retaliate% 2, and have an initiative of 50 for the purpose of focusing.
fh.60: All six Lurkers on tiles 13-B and 13-D are Fractured Lieutenants and add +1 %game.action.attack% to all their attacks.
fh.65: All monsters add %game.action.push% 1 to all their attacks. If the scenario level is 4 or higher, increase this to %game.action.push% 2.
fh.76: Divide the Fish King's maximum hit point value by 2 (rounded down). The Fish King does not act, cannot be targeted by heal abilities, is immune to all conditions, and has an initiative of 01 for the purpose of focusing.

77.1: The Fish King cannot perform any move abilities and is immune to forced movement. (Also adjusted Boss Specials!)

fh.97: To add monster abilities to a character's hand, open the Ability Cards menu and remove the cards from the deck. To play that card, simply add it back in the Edit menu.
fh.112: The two Hounds have twice their maximum hit point values.

128.1: All Steel Automatons use the Imp monster ability deck.
128.2: Whenever any Lurker Wavethrower would summon a Lightening Eel, it summons one Vermling Scout with a current hit point value of 1 instead.

fh.129: All City Guards use Archer monster ability cards instead of their own.
fh.131: Lurker Wavethrowers add +1 %game.action.attack% to all their attacks and do not summon Lightning Eels. Instead, whenever Aid from Below is performed, all Lurker Wavethrowers perform: " %game.action.attack% +1, %game.action.range% 4; %game.action.teleport% to the leftmost empty hex if it is an odd round or rightmost if it is even. If there are several valid hexes to teleport to, choose the hex furthest away from any character."
fh.134: The Steel Automaton has HxC/2 hit points (rounded up).

65-3.1: Open all doors %game.mapMarker.1%. Place all characters and character summons, in initiative order, in the closest empty hex on tile 16-A, then remove all doors and tile 13-A from the map.

1301.text: Have zero cards in your hand each time you rest.

1302.text: Lose a card to negate suffering 5 or more damage.

1303.text: Collect fewer loot tokens than any other character.

1304.text: Kill an enemy attacked by any of your allies earlier in the same round.

1305.text: Occupy a door hex adjacent to two or more enemies at the end of a round.

1306.text: Kill an enemy that has two or more negative conditions.

1307.text: Collect three or more loot tokens in the same turn.

1308.text: Kill the last enemy to die in the scenario.

1309.text: Never perform an action with a lost icon.

1310.text: Never have your hit point value drop below half your maximum hit point value (rounded up).

1311.text: Kill an enemy with an attack that would have caused at least 4 more points of damage than necessary.

1312.text: Collect more loot tokens than any other character.

1313.text: Kill an undamaged enemy with a single attack action.

1314.text: Kill an enemy with an attack that has disadvantage.

1315.text: Kill one or more elite enemies, or two or more for four characters.

1316.text: Suffer damage from an attack in the same round you long rest.

1317.text: End the scenario with a hit point value of 3 or less.

1318.text: Kill an enemy and loot the loot token it drops in the same round.

1319.text: Kill the first enemy to die in the scenario.

1320.text: Remove a negative condition from yourself or an ally two or more times.

1322.text: Never collect a loot token from end-of-turn looting.

1323.text: Never enter a hex occupied by an ally, enemy, objective, or obstacle.

1324.text: End the scenario with your hit point value equal to your maximum hit point value.

1325.text: Collect two or more loot tokens by performing a loot ability while adjacent to one or more enemies.

1326.text: Be targeted by attacks from three or more enemies in the same round.

1327.text: Never kill an elite enemy, named enemy or boss.

1329.text: Perform an ability targeting an ally before your first rest and in between each of your rests.

1330.text: End no more than three of your turns in the hex in which you started the turn, except when long resting.

1331.text: Perform two actions with lost icons in the same turn.

1332.text: Never end your turn adjacent to any other character (gain one additional %game.checkmark% for four characters).

1333.text: Kill an enemy while three or more elements are strong or waning.

1336.text: Kill an enemy not adjacent to you while you are adjacent to another enemy.

1337.text: Have one or more cards in your hand each time you rest.

1338.text: Perform a long rest while at your maximum hit point value, after you have already suffered damage.

1340.text: Have five or more total cards in your hand and discard pile at the end of the scenario.

1341.text: Apply a different negative condition to an enemy that already has one or more negative conditions.

1342.text: Lose a card to negate 2 or less damage from an attack.

1343.text: Become exhausted before any other character.

1344.text: Gain 13 or more experience before any bonus scenario experience.

1345.text: Have three or fewer total cards in your hand and discard pile while also not exhausted at the end of the scenario.

1346.text: Kill an enemy before it takes its first turn.

1347.text: Add two cards to your lost pile before your first rest.

1348.text: Never use your lowest initiative played card as your initiative card.

1349.text: Never exit a hex adjacent to an enemy except through forced movement.

1350.text: Kill one or more enemies of each monster type that appears in the scenario.

1351.text: Gain 7 or fewer experience before any bonus scenario experience.

1352.text: Never exit a room with loot tokens in it.

1353.text: Kill an enemy and open a door in the same turn, in either order.

1355.text: Perform no attack abilities in the first three rounds.

1356.text: Kill two or more enemies in the same round.

1357.text: Move no more than two hexes on each turn.

1359.text: Never attack an enemy that has already acted in the round.

1360.text: End each of your turns adjacent to a wall, obstacle, or objective.

barracks.1:
Collectively train up to 1 soldier for 3 gold and 1 material resource

Capacity: 4
Effect: advantage and -5 %game.action.attack%
barracks.2:
Collectively train up to 1 soldier for 3 gold and 1 material resource

Capacity: 6
Effect: advantage and -15 %game.action.attack%
barracks.3:
Collectively train up to 2 soldiers for 3 gold and 1 material resource

Capacity: 8
Effect: advantage and -25 %game.action.attack%
barracks.4:
Collectively train up to 2 soldiers for 3 gold and 1 material resource

Capacity: 10
Effect: advantage and -35 %game.action.attack%
barracks.5:
Disadvantage on all attack event resolutions.
Cannot use soldiers.

carpenter.1: Reduce all construction costs by 1 material resource
carpenter.2: Reduce all construction costs by 1 material resource and the extra construction cost by 1 morale

enhancer.1: Reduce all enhancement costs by 10 gold
enhancer.2: Reduce all enhancement costs by 10 gold and level penalties by 10 gold per level
enhancer.3: Reduce all enhancement costs by 10 gold, level penalties by 10 gold per level, and repeat penalties by 25 gold per enhancement
enhancer.4: Each character starts the next scenario with %game.condition.disarm%

garden.1: Plant herbs, rotate this card 180°, then stop - Gain 1 herb from each planted plot, then rotate this card 180° then stop
garden.2: Gain 1 collective herb from each planted plot, then plant herbs

hall-of-revelry.1: When the trials deck is complete, read %data.section:187.1

hide-depot.1: Collectively sell up to 1 %game.resource.hide% for 5 gold
hide-depot.2: Collectively sell up to 2 %game.resource.hide% for 5 gold each

hunting-lodge.1: Collectively buy up to 1 %game.resource.hide% for 2 gold
hunting-lodge.2: Collectively buy up to 2 %game.resource.hide% for 2 gold
hunting-lodge.3: Collectively buy up to 3 %game.resource.hide% for 2 gold
hunting-lodge.4: Collectively buy up to 4 %game.resource.hide% for 2 gold

inn.1: Collectively buy up to 1 material resource for 2 gold
inn.2: Collectively buy up to 2 different material resource for 2 gold each
inn.3: Collectively buy up to 3 different material resource for 2 gold each

logging-camp.1: Collectively buy up to 1 %game.resource.lumber% for 2 gold
logging-camp.2: Collectively buy up to 2 %game.resource.lumber% for 2 gold
logging-camp.3: Collectively buy up to 3 %game.resource.lumber% for 2 gold
logging-camp.4: Collectively buy up to 4 %game.resource.lumber% for 2 gold

lumber-depot.1: Collectively sell up to 1 %game.resource.lumber% for 5 gold
lumber-depot.2: Collectively sell up to 2 %game.resource.lumber% for 5 gold each

metal-depot.1: Collectively sell up to 1 %game.resource.metal% for 5 gold
metal-depot.2: Collectively sell up to 2 %game.resource.metal% for 5 gold each

mining-camp.1: Collectively buy up to 1 %game.resource.metal% for 2 gold
mining-camp.2: Collectively buy up to 2 %game.resource.metal% for 2 gold
mining-camp.3: Collectively buy up to 3 %game.resource.metal% for 2 gold
mining-camp.4: Collectively buy up to 4 %game.resource.metal% for 2 gold

stables.1:
Bring one pet into each scenario.
Capacity: 4
stables.2:
Bring one pet into each scenario.
Capacity: 8
stables.3:

Capacity: 8
stables.4:

temple.1: Each character may lose 5 gold to start the next scenario with %game.condition.bless%x2
temple.2: Each character starts the next scenario with %game.condition.curse%

town-hall.1: Draw one challenge and keep up to one. When the challenge deck is complete, read %data.section:190.1%
town-hall.2: Draw two challenges and keep up to one. When the challenge deck is complete, read %data.section:190.1%
town-hall.3: Draw three challenges and keep up to two. When the challenge deck is complete, read %data.section:190.1%

lightning-eel.1: Treats water hexes as corridors and non-water hexes as obstacles

lord-of-chaos.1: Force all enemies to move one hex toward the closest unoccupied corridor hex.

program-director.1: to an empty hex closest to focus
program-director.2: Ally to all monsters this round
program-director.4: to any empty hex closest to focus

render.1: to farthest carving and destroy it.

seeker-of-the-abyss.2: Create one %game.condition.immobilize% trap in an adjacent empty hex.
seeker-of-the-abyss.3: All allies add +1 %game.action.attack% to all their attacks this round.

tormentor.1: Create 1-hex hazardous terrain in all featureless hexes adjacent to target, enemies in these hexes suffer
tormentor.2: Create 1-hex icy terrain in all featureless hexes adjacent to targets of the attack

vestige-of-the-imprisoned-god.2: All characters who did not attack suffer trap damage at end of round.

banner-spear.1: All allies within %game.range:2% add +1 %game.action.attack% to one of their attacks each turn.
banner-spear.2: At the start of their turns, grant allies withing %game.range:3%:
banner-spear.4: Negate the first source of %game.damage% to an adjacent ally each round
banner-spear.5: All enemies within %game.action.range%4 suffer %game.damage:1% at the start of their turns.
banner-spear.6: Add +1 %game.action.attack% for each ally adjacent to the target
banner-spear.7: At the end of each of your long rests, grant one ally within %game.action.range:3%: %game.action.move% 2
banner-spear.8: Whenever you open a door with a move ability, add +3 %game.action.move%
banner-spear.9: Once each scenario, during your turn, gain %game.action.shield% 2 for the round
banner-spear.10: Attack at least three enemies with each of three different area of effect attack abilities
banner-spear.11: Perform a Banner summon ability on your first turn, keep the banner alive and within %game.action.range:3% of you for the entire scenario

blinkblade.1:
On your next attack, discard this card to add +2 %game.action.attack%.
%game.card.persistent%
blinkblade.2: Place this card in your active area. On your next attack, discard this card to add +2 %game.action.attack%
blinkblade.5: Whenever you short rest, you may spend one unspent %game.card.refresh% item for no effect to %game.card.recover% a different spent item
blinkblade.6: At the start of your first turn each scenario, you may perform %game.action.move% 3
blinkblade.7: Whenever you would gain %game.condition.immobilize%, prevent the condition
blinkblade.8: Declare Fast for seven consecutive rounds
blinkblade.9: Never be targeted by an attack

boneshaper.1: +1 %game.action.attack% for each token on this card.
boneshaper.2: Kill the attacking summon to instead add %game.attackmodifier.plus4%
boneshaper.3: Immediately before each of your rests, you may kill one of your summons to perform %game.condition.bless%, self
boneshaper.4: Once each scenario, when any character ally would become exhausted by suffering %game.damage%, you may suffer %game.damage:2% to reduce their hit point value to 1 instead
boneshaper.5: At the start of each scenario, you may play a level 1 card from your hand to perfom a summon action of the card
boneshaper.6: Kill at least fifteen of your summons
boneshaper.7: Play a summon action on your first turn, have the summon kill at least six enemies, and keep it alive for the entire scenario

deathwalker.1: Whenever you long rest, you may move one %data.action.custom.fh-shadow% up to three hexes
deathwalker.2: Whenever you short rest, you may %game.element.consume.dark% to perform %game.condition.muddle%, %game.condition.curse%, %game.action.range:2% as if you were occupying a hex with a %data.action.custom.fh-shadow%
deathwalker.3: While you are occupying a hex with a %data.action.custom.fh-shadow%, all attacks targeting you gain disadvantage
deathwalker.5: Place or remove at least one %data.action.custom.fh-shadow% each round

drifter.1: Move one of your character tokens backward one slot
drifter.2: Whenever you long rest, you may move one of your characters token backward one slot
drifter.3: You may bring one additional %game.items.slots.onehand% item into each scenario
drifter.4: At the end of each scenario you may discard up to two loot cards, except Random Item, to draw that many new loot cards
drifter.5: End a scenario with your character tokens on the last slots of four persistent abilities
drifter.6: Never perform a move ability or attack with a value less then 4, and perform at least one move or attack ability each round

geminate.1: Whenever you short rest, you may remove one negative condition from one ally within %game.action.range:3%
geminate.2: Once each scenario, when you would give yourself a negative condition, prevent the condition
geminate.3: Whenever you perform an action with a lost icon, you may discard one card to %game.card.recover% one card from your discard pile of equal or lower level
geminate.5: Lose at least one ability card each round

errata.env37: 1st Printing: Envelope 37 should list sticker 11 and 13
errata.env44: 1st Printing: Envelope 44 should list sticker 12 and 14
errata.env90: 1st Printing: Envelope 90 should list sticker 1,5,8 and 9
errata.env81: 1st Printing: There is a deck of cards in envelope 81 whose order should be reversed. If you pull it out and the visible card is titled "T___ of W___", reverse the order of the deck so that card is the first drawn when the deck is face-down.
errata.scenario18: 1st Printing: Map layout and map: The right 11 tile should be 11-C.
errata.scenario28: 1st Printing: Archers should spawn at D and Guards at E. The exit hexes are likewise swapped.(Fixed in GHS!)
errata.scenario36-37: 1st Printing: Add the blueprint for Item 067 to the Scenario Rewards. (Fixed in GHS!)
errata.scenario37: 1st Printing: Treasure Chest should be #56. (Fixed in GHS!)
errata.scenario60: 1st Printing: should have Item 224 as a scenario reward. (Fixed in GHS!)
errata.scenario70: 1st Printing: has two Random Items on the Loot Deck. This is a typo; there should be 1. (Fixed in GHS!)
errata.scenario78: 1st Printing: has a tricky map issue - Change the Map Layout image, flipping 13-D and 13-B in that image (and also flipping 13-B in the map depiction on the intro page).
errata.scenraio104: 1st Printing: Second to last line of the special rules: "Ice Wraith" should be "Savvas Icestorm". (Fixed in GHS!)
errata.scenario110: 1st Printing: the water hexes are difficult terrain, not corridor.
errata.scenario111: 1st Printing: The door positions from Section 182.2 are correct. Section 138.2 should link to Section 147.2.
errata.scenario117: 1st Printing: This scenario setup has 5 Polar bears but there are only 4 standees. A fifth Polar bear should be 'proxied' from other available standees or minis. (Fixed in GHS!)
errata.scenario130: 1st Printing: Key - Shrike Fiend has an image of Night Demon. (Fixed in GHS!)
errata.section14-2: 1st Printing: Map: Ice Wraith should be Frost Demon. (Fixed in GHS!)
errata.section25-3: 1st Printing: Section 25.3 - instead of Door 3 opening Section 62.3, this should read Door 1. (Fixed in GHS!)
errata.section111-2: 1st Printing: Map: Lurker Soldier should be Lurker Clawcrusher (Fixed in GHS!)
errata.section154-1: 1st Printing: Map: Black Imp should be Forest Imp. (Fixed in GHS!)
errata.section197-1: 1st Printing: Section 197.1 has outdated descriptions and names of some cards.
errata.tavern3: 1st Printing: This should have a requirement to build of already having 3 coins.
